instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
hello everyone.

This board does not detect voltage when connecting the battery.

already ruled out battery.

when connecting the 87 watt cable, PPBUS is 12.56V

the voltage on the <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> line is 12.57Volts then it drops to 168mv, it's as if it were looking for the battery.

i2c battery lines 3.35 both
<SIGNAL>PCH_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is 2.93V

am i missing something? thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Do you mean the machine works with charger, but doesn't detect battery?
Be sure to have good contacts on J6951.
Check diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines before and after <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I already solved the problem, it was the flex.

The problem with this machine is that suddenly the system is being installed and it shuts down and starts the folder with a question mark.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
